questions.question: What is the unit digit in $\{(6374)^{1793} \times (625)^{317} \times (341)^{491}\}$?
questions.explanation: Unit digit of $4^{\text{odd}}$ is $4$. Unit digit of $5^{\text{any}}$ is $5$. Unit digit of $1^{\text{any}}$ is $1$. Product = $4 \times 5 \times 1 = 20$. Unit digit is $0$.

questions.question: The sum of all two digit numbers divisible by $5$ is
questions.explanation: Two digit numbers divisible by $5$ are $10, 15, 20, \dots, 95$. This is an AP with $a=10$, $l=95$, $d=5$. Number of terms $n = (95-10)/5 + 1 = 18$. Sum = $(n/2)(a+l) = (18/2)(10+95) = 9 \times 105 = 945$.

questions.question: A number when divided by $899$ gives a remainder $63$. If the same number is divided by $29$, the remainder will be
questions.explanation: Number = $899k + 63$. Since $899$ is divisible by $29$ ($29 \times 31 = 899$), we only need to divide the remainder $63$ by $29$. $63 = 29 \times 2 + 5$. Remainder is $5$.

questions.question: If $9171X14264$ is divisible by $88$, what is the value of $X$?
questions.explanation: For divisibility by $88$, the number must be divisible by $8$ and $11$. $264$ is divisible by $8$. For $11$, the difference between the sum of digits at odd places and even places must be $0$ or divisible by $11$. (Sum of digits at odd places) - (Sum of digits at even places) $= (9+7+X+4+6) - (1+1+1+2+4) = (26+X) - 9 = 17+X$. For $17+X$ to be divisible by $11$, $X=5$.

questions.question: The divisor is $25$ times the quotient and $5$ times the remainder. If the quotient is $16$, the dividend is
questions.explanation: Divisor = $25 \times \text{Quotient} = 25 \times 16 = 400$. Divisor = $5 \times \text{Remainder} \implies 400 = 5 \times \text{Remainder} \implies \text{Remainder} = 80$. Dividend = $(\text{Divisor} \times \text{Quotient}) + \text{Remainder} = (400 \times 16) + 80 = 6400 + 80 = 6480$.

questions.question: A six digit number is formed by repeating a three digit number; for example, $256, 256$ or $678, 678$ etc. Any number of this form is always exactly divisible by:
questions.explanation: A number of the form $xyzxyz = xyz \times 1000 + xyz = xyz \times 1001$. Since $1001 = 7 \times 11 \times 13$, the number is divisible by $1001$.

questions.question: The smallest number which when divided by $3, 5, 8, 12$ leaves remainders $2, 4, 7, 11$ respectively is
questions.explanation: The difference between divisor and remainder is constant: $3-2=1$, $5-4=1$, $8-7=1$, $12-11=1$. LCM of $3, 5, 8, 12$ is $120$. Required number = LCM - Constant difference $= 120 - 1 = 119$.

questions.question: A number when divided by $5$ leaves a remainder of $4$. When the double (i.e., twice) of that number is divided by $5$ the remainder will be:
questions.explanation: Let number $N = 5k + 4$. Double the number $2N = 10k + 8$. $2N$ divided by $5$: $(10k + 8)/5 \implies$ Remainder is $3$ (since $8/5$ gives remainder $3$).

questions.question: Six bells commence tolling together and toll at intervals of $2, 4, 6, 8, 10$ and $12$ seconds respectively. In $30$ minutes, how many times do they toll together?
questions.explanation: LCM of $2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12$ is $120$ seconds $= 2$ minutes. In $30$ minutes, they toll together $(30/2) + 1 = 16$ times (including the start).

questions.question: The product of two numbers is $4107$. If the H.C.F. of these numbers is $37$, then the greater number is:
questions.explanation: Let numbers be $37a$ and $37b$. Product = $37a \times 37b = 1369ab = 4107 \implies ab = 3$. Since $a$ and $b$ are co-prime, pairs are $(1, 3)$. Numbers are $37 \times 1 = 37$ and $37 \times 3 = 111$. Greater number is $111$.

questions.question: The value of $k$ if $(x-1)$ is a factor of $4x^3 + 3x^2 - 4x + k$ is
questions.explanation: If $(x-1)$ is a factor, then $P(1) = 0$. $4(1)^3 + 3(1)^2 - 4(1) + k = 0 \implies 4 + 3 - 4 + k = 0 \implies 3 + k = 0 \implies k = -3$.

questions.question: If $1.5x = 0.04y$, then value of $(y-x)/(y+x)$ is
A number consists of two digits. If the digits interchange places and the new number is added to the original number, then the resulting number will be divisible by:
questions.explanation: Let number be $10x + y$. Reversed number is $10y + x$. Sum = $11x + 11y = 11(x+y)$. Always divisible by $11$.

questions.question: Ten watermelons, six mangoes and nine guavas cost Rs. $1580$. What is the cost of six mangoes, ten watermelons and four guavas?
questions.explanation: We have one equation: $10W + 6M + 9G = 1580$. We need to find $10W + 6M + 4G$. With $3$ variables and only $1$ equation, we cannot determine the unique value.

questions.question: Reynolds offers a total of $150$ pens to its customers. As per the scheme, one pen will be offered on the purchase of a "Quantitative Aptitude" book. Out of $150$ pens, the cost of some pens is Rs. $3$ and the cost of the rest of the pens is Rs. $5$. At the most, how many customers can avail a pen of Rs. $5$ as an offer from the company if the total cost of the pens cannot exceed Rs. $745$.
questions.explanation: Let $x$ be number of Rs. $5$ pens. Then $(150-x)$ are Rs. $3$ pens. $5x + 3(150-x) \le 745 \implies 5x + 450 - 3x \le 745 \implies 2x \le 295 \implies x \le 147.5$. Max integer $x$ is $147$.

questions.question: $4/15$ of $5/7$ of a number is greater than $4/9$ of $2/5$ of the same number by $8$. What is half of that number?
questions.explanation: Let number be $x$. $(4/15 \times 5/7 \times x) - (4/9 \times 2/5 \times x) = 8 \implies (4/21)x - (8/45)x = 8$. LCM of $21$ and $45$ is $315$. $(60x - 56x)/315 = 8 \implies 4x = 8 \times 315 \implies x = 630$. Half of $x = 315$.

questions.question: A crate of mangoes contains one bruised mango for every $30$ mangoes in the crate. If $3$ out of every $4$ bruised mangoes are considered unsaleable, and there are $12$ unsaleable mangoes in the crate, how many mangoes are there in the crate?
questions.explanation: $12$ unsaleable mangoes represent $3/4$ of bruised mangoes. Total bruised = $12 \times (4/3) = 16$. Total mangoes = $16 \times 30 = 480$.

questions.question: The number of prime factors of $(3 \times 5)^{12} (2 \times 7)^{10} (10)^{25}$ is:
questions.explanation: Expression = $3^{12} \times 5^{12} \times 2^{10} \times 7^{10} \times (2 \times 5)^{25} = 3^{12} \times 5^{12} \times 2^{10} \times 7^{10} \times 2^{25} \times 5^{25} = 2^{35} \times 3^{12} \times 5^{37} \times 7^{10}$. Total prime factors = $35 + 12 + 37 + 10 = 94$. Option 'None' is correct.

questions.question: How many numbers are there between $200$ and $800$ which are divisible by both $5$ and $7$?
questions.explanation: LCM of $5$ and $7$ is $35$. Multiples of $35$ between $200$ and $800$: First is $210$ ($35 \times 6$), last is $770$ ($35 \times 22$). Number of terms = $22 - 6 + 1 = 17$.

questions.question: A boy was asked to find the value of $3/8$ of a sum of money. Instead of multiplying the sum by $3/8$ he divided it by $3/8$ and then his answer exceeded by Rs. $55$. Find the correct answer?
questions.explanation: Let sum be $x$. $(x / (3/8)) - (x \times 3/8) = 55 \implies (8x/3) - (3x/8) = 55 \implies (64x - 9x)/24 = 55 \implies 55x = 55 \times 24 \implies x = 24$. Correct answer = $24 \times 3/8 = 9$.

questions.question: A group of friends decided to go on a picnic with eatables worth Rs. $96$. Four of them did not turn up. As a consequence, the remaining ones had to contribute Rs. $4$ each extra. The number of those who attended the picnic was
questions.explanation: Let original number be $x$. $96/(x-4) - 96/x = 4 \implies 24/(x-4) - 24/x = 1 \implies 24x - 24(x-4) = x(x-4) \implies 96 = x^2 - 4x \implies x^2 - 4x - 96 = 0 \implies (x-12)(x+8)=0 \implies x=12$. Attended = $12-4 = 8$.

questions.question: Some friends planned to go for a picnic and spend Rs. $100$ on eatables. $5$ of them did not turn up. As a consequence, the remaining ones had to contribute Rs. $1$ each extra. The number of those who attended the picnic was
questions.explanation: Let original number be $x$. $100/(x-5) - 100/x = 1 \implies 100x - 100(x-5) = x(x-5) \implies 500 = x^2 - 5x \implies x^2 - 5x - 500 = 0 \implies (x-25)(x+20)=0 \implies x=25$. Attended = $25-5 = 20$.

questions.question: A box contains $385$ marbles. They are to be distributed among some friends such that each friend receives marbles equal to the number of friends. However, there are $24$ marbles left. How many friends are there?
questions.explanation: Let $n$ be number of friends. Each gets $n$ marbles. Total used = $n^2$. $n^2 + 24 = 385 \implies n^2 = 361 \implies n = 19$.

questions.question: A basket contains $200$ oranges. They are distributed among $25$ friends equally. Had there been $5$ more friends each would have received one orange less. How many friends were there?
questions.explanation: Let there be $x$ friends originally. $200/x - 200/(x+5) = 1 \implies x^2 + 5x - 1000 = 0 \implies (x+25)(x-20) = 0 \implies x=20$. So $20$ friends were there originally.

questions.question: Which is greater among $4^{300}$ or $3^{400}$?
For a Natural Number $n$, $n^4 + n^2 + 1$ is
questions.explanation: If $n$ is even, $n^4$ and $n^2$ are even, sum + $1$ is Odd. If $n$ is odd, $n^4$ and $n^2$ are odd, odd+odd+1 = even+1 = Odd. Always Odd.

questions.question: By what smallest number must $21600$ be multiplied or divided in order to make it a perfect square?
questions.explanation: $21600 = 216 \times 100 = 6^3 \times 10^2 = 2^3 \times 3^3 \times 10^2$. Powers: $2^3$ (odd), $3^3$ (odd). Need one more $2$ and one more $3$ to make powers even. Factor needed = $2 \times 3 = 6$.

questions.question: Dividing by $3/8$ then multiplying by $5/6$ is equivalent to dividing by
questions.explanation: Operation: $x / (3/8) \times (5/6) = x \times (8/3) \times (5/6) = x \times (40/18) = x \times (20/9)$. This is equivalent to dividing by $9/20$.

A call center agent has a list of $305$ phone numbers of people in alphabetic order of names (but she does not have any of the names). She needs to quickly contact Deepak Sharma to convey a message to him. If each call takes $2$ minutes to complete, and every call is answered, what is the minimum amount of time in which she can guarantee to deliver the message to Deepak Sharma?
questions.explanation: This is a binary search problem. $\log_2(305)$ is approx $8.25$. So $9$ calls are needed in the worst case. $9 \times 2$ minutes = $18$ minutes.
